title: How can you fix your mmr?
body: My mmr is pretty bad. would it help to duo with someone from higher mmr? or do i just need solo win streaks?

replies.body: Get better, win games. Sadly this season it is drowned in a sea of luck.
Luck does not seem to find me often
Have more than 50% win ratio and your MMR will go up.
yeah diamond friend told me 10 games over is rule of thumb. Gonna have to win streak.

You can artificially improve your mmr in an increased manner by duoing with a higher ranked player (as the aggregate opponent MMR will be higher), but the qualifier is still the same: You need to win. Winning is the only thing that really corrects MMR.
This is what i was looking for. It's not really artificial per se since you're playing a harder game, but thank you.

Happy to help.

It depends what you mean.  

If you mean how do you improve your skills, then there are several websites that will help you do that.  Mostly though: watch how excellent players position, when & where they ward, and how they encourage their teammates.

If you mean how do you boost your MMR to above your actual skill level---you really don't want to do this.  What that would do is constantly put your team a a significant skill disadvantage to your opponents until your MMR came back down to your skill.  So you would just lose a lot of games in a row.

If you mean how do you improve you ELO (your ranked ranking), find one champion you don't mind playing a lot who is almost never banned, and play that champ exclusively, switching to one or two other champs as needed.  Any champ you put in an extra 100 games with will be significantly higher skill than your other champs, and using that one exclusively you can slowly gain ranks.  Effectively that divorces your skill with that champ from your general play skill, and you get to keep the resulting ELO.  

But my real advice: play to have fun.  Don't worry about your ELO or MMR.  There are trolls and ragers in every division--as well as great teammates.  Just have fun.
good god dude. you dont know what mmr is. very annoying and useless comment

MMR is what Riot's system thinks your skill level is.  No more, no less.  If you've played several dozen games in a particular mode, it's probably fairly close.  Asking how to increase that without instead of just asking how to improve your skill is a strange request, which is why I gave several possible answers.  

It's not a terrible idea to play with a friend who is better than you.  That's a great way to learn, & avoids the frustrations (and low learning potential) of being the best player on a team, which would of course otherwise happen ~20% of the time.  The primary thing this changes is your skill, which then leads to a change in your MMR.  Trying to go the other way around is either nonsensical or self-defeating.

Winning and playing well.

That's about it.
